item.title: Using gtags for code navigation
item.description: Introduction GNU Global, also known as gtags is a source code tagging system that works the same way across diverse environments. It can be used in shell, vim, emacs and more. Why `gtags`? Independent of any editor. Has capability to treat definition and reference. Substantially faster than cscope and ctags. Installation Ubuntu sudo apt install global MacOS Using homebrew. brew install global Build from source Get source code from global server and extract it.

item.title: shell one-liner for infinite loop
item.description: This is for a quick reference (copy-pasta). While loop This is compatible with all POSIX complient shells. while true; do date; sleep 5; done For loop If you don’t need to support sh for ((;;)) { date ; sleep 5 ; }

item.title: Adding static IPv4 in Freebsd
item.description: This is quick how-to guide on adding to FreeBSD machine. Set permanent IP Open /etc/rc.conf vi /etc/rc.conf Search for ifconfig_xn0 (xn0 is interface name) and edit its contents to reflect your IP. hostname="freebsd" ifconfig_xn0="inet 192.168.10.1 netmask 255.255.250.0" Run the /etc/netstart script to update configuration. ./etc/netstart Set temporary IP NOTE: IP will be reverted after reboot. Get the interface name using ifconfig -a (you don’t want lo interface) $ ifconfig -a lo0: flags=8049<UP,LOOPBACK,RUNNING,MULTICAST> metric 0 mtu 16384 .
